title: I appear to be drunk.
content:
And yet I can astill rype fairly cpherently.

I'm talking to a long-rtime friensd I've noty trulty conversed with for a long while, borrowing his broadband and watching Rage.

It seems weven whe nI'm trunk I'm talking about a multiplayer Keen. Isn't that amusing? We were talking a bout the first time we played a deathmatch game of Doom, which happ[ened to be at a mutyual friend's dad's 40th many years ago, and we started talking about holding a DOS LAN.

Woogh.

Anyway, I'm still around. My ex just left for a oine-night stand and food. She's insane, and quite liost. I see it's been quiet around here... I ewxpect to see at least a new mod when I return full-0tiome!@!

HARDCORE!

Uh, sorry about the ranting and spam-like nature of this post, but I figure I might as well post something to let y'all know I'm still alive.

Hahahah. Corey got kicked out of his bed. He just returned to the kitchen for more food. This place is amusing. I think we just freaked him out. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: I appear to be drunk.
Re: I appear to be drunk.
content:
Haha, nice to hear about you Spleen! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Hopefully you'll return soon full time. I was already about to e-mail you and ask how it's going. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] Too bad to hear that she's now an ex.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Take care.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: I appear to be drunk.
content:
Yarr. Hello there. I am kinda new, but I've seen your posts in older topics.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: hehe
content:
If there was ever a KeenFest, I think it'd be a requirement for us to all buy Spleen a drink. Maybe two.

(Welcome back)

title: Re: hehe
content:
No... Spleen AND Levellord... Seriously... she won't refuse ANYTHING and quite frankly... trying to see her walk when smashed is the most amusing sight to behold. Not to mention the conversations.

Oh and buy Gal a beer. Just because I like free drinks.

Yea... I learned my lesson about coming online when under the influence. (Back when I had my wisdom teeth removed. Seriously... those hardcore painkillers make you do things that make you act like a noob.) I hope Commander Spleen comes back and reads this and is all like "OMG! WTFBBQ!"

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Well anyways. Nice to hear from you. You really were fun to talk to even though I am a bit of a bore on MSN.

SPLEEN! Come back Spleen!-----------------------

title: Re: I appear to be drunk.
content:
Hey Spleen! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I remember playing Deathmatch Doom (and of course coop-always-turns-into-DM-after-a-stray-rocket Doom) in the past, and have fond memories of that as well.
I installed [url=http://www.skulltag.com/]Skulltag[/url] (hey, apparently there's a trailer now in case you're interested) a long time ago, but I never really started playing it.
That reminds me, I also still want to play through Doom: Collector's Edition with ZDoomGL sometime.

Anyway, I found that a good game of UT2004 (I only started chatting online with my friends/enemies after the game(s) with this game, since I only had dialup in my Doom days) makes my typing a LOT worse than drinking ever did.
Too much adrenaline apparently influences my motor skills more than alcohol.

Uhm... hoorray for beer!?Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
